articles.headline: Yellen Wins Backing of Senators to Lead Fed
articles.snippet: As chairwoman, Ms. Yellen will face an arduous task overseeing the gradual unwinding of stimulus measures, despite an uncomfortably high unemployment rate of 7 percent and subdued inflation.
articles.abstract: As chairwoman, Ms. Yellen will face an arduous task overseeing the gradual unwinding of stimulus measures, despite an uncomfortably high unemployment rate of 7 percent and subdued inflation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate confirmed Janet L. Yellen as the chairwoman of the Federal Reserve on Monday, marking the first time that a woman will lead the country’s central bank in its 100-year history.

articles.headline: U.S. and Iran Face Common Enemies in Mideast Strife
articles.snippet: The United States and Iran are being drawn together by their mutual opposition to a movement of Sunni fighters raising Al Qaeda’s flag in Syria, Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Yemen.
articles.abstract: The United States and Iran are being drawn together by their mutual opposition to a movement of Sunni fighters raising Al Qaeda’s flag in Syria, Lebanon, Iraq, Afghanistan and Yemen.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Even as the United States and Iran pursue negotiations on Tehran’s nuclear program, they find themselves on the same side of a range of regional issues surrounding an insurgency raging across the Middle East.

articles.headline: Bone-Chilling Cold a Crippling Blow to Air Travel
articles.snippet: Airlines canceled 4,400 flights on Monday, bringing the total to more than 17,000 over the last week, as brutal winter weather engulfed much of the country.
articles.abstract: Airlines canceled 4,400 flights on Monday, bringing the total to more than 17,000 over the last week, as brutal winter weather engulfed much of the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: The chaos in the nation’s air travel system worsened on Monday as a wave of frigid weather forced airlines to cancel thousands more flights, stranding passengers from Fort Lauderdale, Fla., to Los Angeles.

articles.headline: A Makeover for Maps
articles.snippet: Some graphic designers are trying to improve presentation of information using video and color rather than simple bar charts and graphs.
articles.abstract: Some graphic designers are trying to improve presentation of information using video and color rather than simple bar charts and graphs.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like many designers, Eric Rodenbeck has had a long relationship with bar graphs and pie charts. He just thinks they are a little old school for today’s data-filled world.

articles.headline: Never Mind the Résumé. How Hot Is the C.E.O.?
articles.snippet: A study suggests that investors give higher share values to companies run by attractive chief executives.
articles.abstract: A study suggests that investors give higher share values to companies run by attractive chief executives.

articles.headline: Germany Adds Lessons in Islam to Better Blend Its Melting Pot
articles.snippet: Public schools for the first time are offering classes in Islam to primary school students to better integrate Germany’s large Muslim minority and to try to counter the influence of radical religious thinking.
articles.abstract: Public schools for the first time are offering classes in Islam to primary school students to better integrate Germany’s large Muslim minority and to try to counter the influence of radical religious thinking.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — For the first time, German public schools are offering classes in Islam to primary school students using state-trained teachers and specially written textbooks, as officials try to better integrate the nation’s large Muslim minority and counter the growing influence of radical religious thinking.

articles.headline: Trial to Begin for Martoma, Ex-SAC Trader Who Cut No Deal
articles.snippet: Mathew Martoma has resisted aiding a long-running federal investigation of SAC Capital Advisors and its founder, Steven A. Cohen.
articles.abstract: Mathew Martoma has resisted aiding a long-running federal investigation of SAC Capital Advisors and its founder, Steven A. Cohen.
articles.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors never thought their insider trading case against Mathew Martoma would go to trial.
articles.byline: By Matthew Goldstein and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Burglars Who Took On F.B.I. Abandon Shadows
articles.snippet: Burglars who broke into an F.B.I. field office in 1971 and stole files that revealed the extent of the bureau’s surveillance of political groups are only now revealing their identities.
articles.abstract: Burglars who broke into an F.B.I. field office in 1971 and stole files that revealed the extent of the bureau’s surveillance of political groups are only now revealing their identities.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA — The perfect crime is far easier to pull off when nobody is watching.

articles.headline: Faulty Websites Confront Needy in Search of Aid
articles.snippet: Efforts at modernizing the systems for government aid in many states have largely backfired in recent months, causing enormous cost overruns and delays for benefits.
articles.abstract: Efforts at modernizing the systems for government aid in many states have largely backfired in recent months, causing enormous cost overruns and delays for benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Three months after the disastrous rollout of a new $63 million website for unemployment claims, Florida is hiring hundreds of employees to deal with technical problems that left tens of thousands of people without their checks while penalties mount against the vendor who set up the site.

articles.headline: Labor Tactic Raises Fear for France
articles.snippet: The kidnapping of two executives at a Goodyear factory have become one of the most potent symbols of the challenges companies face in France.
articles.abstract: The kidnapping of two executives at a Goodyear factory have become one of the most potent symbols of the challenges companies face in France.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Negotiations broke down last weekend at a Goodyear tire factory scheduled for closing in northern France, so employees resorted to a brazen tactic: They kidnapped the bosses.

articles.headline: JPMorgan Is Penalized $2 Billion Over Madoff
articles.snippet: The bank will pay the fine, a record for a violation of the Bank Secrecy Act, for failing to report suspicious activity by its client Bernard L. Madoff to authorities.
articles.abstract: The bank will pay the fine, a record for a violation of the Bank Secrecy Act, for failing to report suspicious activity by its client Bernard L. Madoff to authorities.
articles.lead_paragraph: Updated, 9:37 p.m. | Two men who occupy coveted roles in Manhattan’s power elite, one the city’s top federal prosecutor and the other its top banker, sat down in early November to discuss a case that was weighing on them both.
articles.byline: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
